Camera setup

Pixel size

The size of one camera pixel projected to the sample plane. It is used to convert molecule coordinates from pixels to nm, to correctly calculate localization uncertainty of PSF fitting estimators and also in artificial data generator.

Image intensity to photoelectrons

These parameters are used to convert image intensity (A/D count) to the number of photoelectrons. The formula for conversion is

where is image intensity in A/D counts, is the number of photolectrons and are the following camera characteristics:

Photoelectrons per A/D count,

CCD sensitivity.

Base level,

Constant offset added to the image intensity by the camera.

EM gain,

EM gain for EMCCD cameras. If the checkbox is not selected a CCD camera is assumed. Note that the outcome of setting the EM gain to 1 and unchecking the button is different. Different formulas for calculating localization uncertainty are used for CCD and EMCCD cameras. Also the stochastic nature of EM gain is modelled in artificial data generator.
